Method Detail

obtainReactivationKey

public java.lang.String obtainReactivationKey(java.lang.String sessionKey,
                                              java.lang.Integer sid)
                                       throws FaultException
Get a reactivation key for this server.

Parameters:
sessionKey - The sessionKey containing the logged in user
sid - The id of the server in question
Returns:
Returns the reactivation key string for the given server
Throws:
FaultException - A FaultException is thrown if: - The server corresponding to the sid cannot be found - The server doesn't have the "agent smith" feature

obtainReactivationKey

public java.lang.String obtainReactivationKey(java.lang.String clientCert)
                                       throws FaultException,
                                              MethodInvalidParamException
Get a reactivation key for this server.

Parameters:
clientCert - client certificate of the system.
Returns:
Returns the reactivation key string for the given server
Throws:
FaultException - A FaultException is thrown if: - The server corresponding to the sid cannot be found - The server doesn't have the "agent smith" feature
MethodInvalidParamException - thrown if certificate is invalid.
Since:
10.10

upgradeEntitlement

public int upgradeEntitlement(java.lang.String sessionKey,
                              java.lang.Integer sid,
                              java.lang.String entitlementLevel)
                       throws FaultException
Adds an entitlement to a given server.

Parameters:
sessionKey - The sessionKey containing the logged in user
sid - The id of the server in question
entitlementLevel - The entitlement to add to the server
Returns:
Returns 1 if successful, exception otherwise
Throws:
FaultException - A FaultException is thrown if: - The server corresponding to the sid cannot be found - The logged in user cannot access the system - The entitlement cannot be found - The server cannot be entitled with the given entitlement - There are no available slots for the entitlement.

setChildChannels

public int setChildChannels(java.lang.String sessionKey,
                            java.lang.Integer sid,
                            java.util.List channelIdsOrLabels)
                     throws FaultException
Subscribe the given server to the child channels provided. This method will unsubscribe the server from any child channels that the server is currently subscribed to, but that are not included in the list. The user may provide either a list of channel ids (int) or a list of channel labels (string) as input.

Parameters:
sessionKey - The sessionKey containing the logged in user
sid - The id of the server in question
channelIdsOrLabels - The list of channel ids or labels this server should be subscribed to.
Returns:
Returns 1 if successful, exception otherwise.
Throws:
FaultException - A FaultException is thrown if: - the server corresponding to sid cannot be found. - the channel corresponding to cid is not a valid child channel. - the user doesn't have subscribe access to any one of the current or new child channels.

setBaseChannel

@Deprecated
public int setBaseChannel(java.lang.String sessionKey,
                                     java.lang.Integer sid,
                                     java.lang.Integer cid)
                   throws FaultException
Deprecated. being replaced by system.setBaseChannel(string sessionKey, int serverId, string channelLabel)

Sets the base channel for the given server to the given channel

Parameters:
sessionKey - The sessionKey containing the logged in user
sid - The id for the server
cid - The id for the channel
Returns:
Returns 1 if successful, exception otherwise
Throws:
FaultException - A FaultException is thrown if: - the server corresponding to sid cannot be found. - the channel corresponding to cid is not a base channel. - the user doesn't have subscribe access to either the current or the new base channel.

FaultException - A FaultException is thrown if the server corresponding to sid cannot be found.

listOlderInstalledPackages

public java.lang.Object[] listOlderInstalledPackages(java.lang.String sessionKey,
                                                     java.lang.Integer sid,
                                                     java.lang.String name,
                                                     java.lang.String version,
                                                     java.lang.String release,
                                                     java.lang.String epoch)
                                              throws FaultException
Given a package name + version + release + epoch, returns the list of packages installed on the system w/ the same name that are older.

Parameters:
sessionKey - The sessionKey containing the logged in user
sid - The id of the system you're checking
name - The name of the package you're checking
version - The version of the package
release - The release of the package
epoch - The epoch of the package
Returns:
Returns a list of packages installed on the system with the same name that * are older.
Throws:
FaultException - A FaultException is thrown if the server corresponding to sid cannot be found or if no package with the given name is found.

                                                     java.lang.Integer sid,

epoch - The epoch of the package
Returns:

Throws:
FaultException - A FaultException is thrown if the server corresponding to sid cannot be found or if no package with the given name is found.

listPackagesFromChannel

public java.lang.Object[] listPackagesFromChannel(java.lang.String sessionKey,
                                                  java.lang.Integer sid,
                                                  java.lang.String channelLabel)
Lists all of the packages that are installed on a system that also belong to a particular channel. NOTE: when the arch for an installed package is unavailable we do not take it into concern, meaning that it is arch unaware. This is usually the case for RHEL 4 or older. RHEL 5 started uploading arch information, so that information is taken into account when matching packages.

Parameters:
sessionKey - the session key
sid - the system Id
channelLabel - the channel label
Returns:
Array of Package objects representing the intersection of the channel packages and the system's installed packages

sessionKey - User's session key.
sid - ID of the server.
earliestOccurrence - Earliest occurrence of the refresh.
Returns:
the id of the action scheduled, exception thrown otherwise

scheduleScriptRun

public java.lang.Integer scheduleScriptRun(java.lang.String sessionKey,
                                           java.util.List systemIds,
                                           java.lang.String username,
                                           java.lang.String groupname,
                                           java.lang.Integer timeout,
                                           java.lang.String script,
                                           java.util.Date earliest)
Schedule a script to run.

Parameters:
sessionKey - User's session key.
systemIds - IDs of the servers to run the script on.
username - User to run script as.
groupname - Group to run script as.
timeout - Seconds to allow the script to run before timing out.
script - Contents of the script to run.
earliest - Earliest the script can run.
Returns:
ID of the new script action.

                                            java.lang.Integer sid)
                                     throws FaultException

Parameters:

sid - The id of the system in question
Returns:
Returns an array of maps representing the proxies the system is connected through
Throws:
FaultException - A FaultException is thrown if the server corresponding to sid cannot be found.

setupStaticNetwork

public int setupStaticNetwork(java.lang.String clientcert,
                              java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> data)
Method to setup the static network configuration for a given server This is used by spacewalkkoan if the user selects static networking option in the advanced configuration section during provisioning. It basically adds $static_network variable to the cobbler system record which gets rendered during the kickstart.

Parameters:
clientcert - the client certificate or the system id file
data - a map holding the network details like ip, gateway, name servers, ip, netmask and hostname.
Returns:
1 on success exception otherwise.

setupStaticNetwork

public int setupStaticNetwork(java.lang.String clientcert,
                              java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> data,
                              java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> data6)
Method to setup the static network IPv4 and IPv6 configuration for a given server This is used by spacewalkkoan if the user selects static networking option in the advanced configuration section during provisioning. It basically adds $static_network variable to the cobbler system record which gets rendered during the kickstart.

Parameters:
clientcert - the client certificate or the system id file
data - a map holding the IPv4 network details like ip, gateway, name servers, ip, netmask and hostname.
data6 - a map holding the IPv6 network details like ip, netmask, gateway and device.
Returns:
1 on success exception otherwise.
